page.title: 17TRULY RURAL PERSON
page.content: Mrs. Mc.Creadie is truly rural; daughter of the local joiner, she was born and educated in Dunino and for the last 21 years (1963-84) was Headteacher at Dunino School. She spent her childhood and young adulthood (1921-46) at Bellrock View, altered by her father in 1910 and renamed, appropriately, since it offers a view of the Bellrock Lighthouse.Many years ago the local tailor stayed in the house and to this day the hill going towards the house is still known as "The Tylers Brae". Mrs. McCreadie has seen several changes, from the threshing mill and binders to the combine harvester, over the last 60 years. Farms were labour intensive, conditioned by horse power, employees included coach and groomsmen and the day started at 5a.m. in the stables.
